    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Lamia Matriarch</h1>The brilliant and powerful lamia matriarchs possess boundless ambition, always seeking to bring more people and territory into the clutches of their kind. Consequently, the become rulers of other lamia. For all their cruelty toward other creatures, they’re fierce protectors of other lamia, and consequently they quickly come to rule cults or warbands. Regardless of the lamia’s gender, these ascended lamias are always known as matriarchs. Rather than leonine limbs, a lamia matriarch’s lower body is formed in the winding coils of a giant snake. They’re also set apart by the occult power they pursue, and some have even have grand designs to break the animalistic curse that transformed them. However, every attempt so far has led to the matriarch’s fall.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Beast</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=2">Arcana</a></u>, <u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=10">Nature</a></u>)</b>: DC 24<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=278">Lamia Matriarch</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 8</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Lamia_LamiaMatriarch.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Lamia_LamiaMatriarch.png"></a><span alt="Chaotic Evil" class="traitalignment" title="Chaotic Evil">CE</span><span alt="Large" class="traitsize" title="Large">Large</span><span alt="Beast Trait" class="trait" title="A creature similar to an animal but with an Intelligence modifier of –3 or higher is usually a beast. Unlike an animal, a beast might be able to speak and reason."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=20">Beast</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 217</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +15; darkvision<br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=12"><u>Abyssal</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=1"><u>Common</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=2"><u>Draconic</a></u><br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=2"><u>Arcana</a></u> +18, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=8"><u>Cult Lore</a></u> +15, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5"><u>Deception</a></u> +20, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=6"><u>Diplomacy</a></u> +20, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=7"><u>Intimidation</a></u> +18, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=11"><u>Occultism</a></u> +17, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=15"><u>Stealth</a></u> +16, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=16"><u>Survival</a></u> +13<br /><b>Str</b> +6, <b>Dex</b> +4, <b>Con</b> +3, <b>Int</b> +3, <b>Wis</b> +3, <b>Cha</b> +6<br /><b>Items</b> <i>+1 <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Equipment.aspx?ID=280">striking</a> <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Weapons.aspx?ID=38">scimitar</a></i><hr /><b>AC</b> 27, <b>Fort</b> +13, <b>Ref</b> +18, <b>Will</b> +17; +1 status to all saves vs. magic<br /><b>HP</b> 135; <b>Immunities</b> controlled; <b>Resistances</b> mental 10<hr /><b>Speed</b> 30 feet, climb 30 feet, swim 30 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> <i>scimitar</i> +19 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=180"><u>forceful +2</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=194"><u>sweep</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 2d6+10 slashing</span><b>Occult Spontaneous Spells</b> DC 28; <b>3rd</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=78">dispel magic</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=104">enthrall</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=147">haste</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=194">mind reading</a></u></i> (4 slots); <b>2nd</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=28">blur</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=63">death knell</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=158">illusory creature</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=164">invisibility</a></u></i> (4 slots); <b>1st</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=25">bless</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=180">magic missile</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=220">phantom pain</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=291">soothe</a></u></i> (4 slots); <b>Cantrips</b> <b>(3rd)</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=61">daze</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=66">detect magic</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=177">mage hand</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=229">prestidigitation</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=246">read aura</a></u></i><br /><b>Occult Innate Spells</b> DC 28; <b>4th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=34">charm</a></u></i> (x3), <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=315">suggestion</a></u></i> (x3); <b>3rd</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=288">sleep</a></u></i>; <b>2nd</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=159">illusory disguise</a></u></i> (at will), <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=160">illusory object</a></u></i> (at will), <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=197">mirror image</a></u></i>; <b>1st</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=356">ventriloquism</a></u></i> (at will)<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Change Shape</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=32"><u>concentrate</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=120"><u>occult</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=127"><u>polymorph</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=157"><u>transmutation</a></u>) The lamia matriarch can take on the appearance of a Medium humanoid. This doesn’t change their Speed or their attack and damage modifiers with their Strikes, but it does prevent them from using their cursed touch. Each lamia matriarch has a fixed humanoid form—they cannot adopt a different appearance each time they use this ability, and the appearance resembles that of their upper torso when in their true form.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Dervish Strike</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Three Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\ThreeActions.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Three Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\ThreeActions_I.png">  The lamia matriarch makes a scimitar attack against each enemy within reach. Each attack counts toward their multiple attack penalty, but the penalty does not increase until after all the attacks. The first enemy she damages is subject to matriarch’s caress.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Matriarch's Caress</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=38"><u>curse</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=61"><u>enchantment</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=106"><u>mental</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=120"><u>occult</a></u>) The lamia touches a creature, who must succeed at a DC 28 Will save or become <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=37">stupefied 1</a> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=37">stupefied 2</a> if critically failed). If the target fails additional saves against this ability, the condition value increases by 1 if failed or 2 if critically failed (to a maximum of stupefied 4). This condition value decreases by 1 every 24 hours.</span><h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=66">Lamia</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=277">Lamia</a></td><td>6</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=278">Lamia Matriarch</a></td><td>8</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=66">Lamia</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 216</i></a><br />Lamias are bloodthirsty victims of an ancient curse for which they blame the gods. Most lamias are humanoid from the waist up but have the lower bodies of beasts and monsters. Sinister magic comes naturally to a lamia, and they prefer the use of illusions and enchantments to deceive prey for later consumption, or simply to torture.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Locations" title="Sidebar - Locations" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_3_Locations.png"> Lamia Location</h3>Lamias dwell on the edge of civilization in crumbling keeps, abandoned cities, and the fallen temples of forgotten gods.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Treasure and Rewards" title="Sidebar - Treasure and Rewards" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_5_TreasureAndRewards.png"> Lamia Treasure</h3>Lamias salvage gold, jewels, and magic items from the abandoned temples and ruined cities where they make their lairs. They sometimes arm themselves with enchanted daggers.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Related Creatures" title="Sidebar - Related Creatures" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png"> Other Lamias</h3>Adventurers report encounters with other varieties of lamia, including immense versions with the upper torsos of giants, monstrosities driven by insatiable hunger, or flying buzzard-like beasts with hardly any humanoid features, yet all of these variants bow to the wisdom and influence of the lamia matriarchs.</span>

    <br />

  <script>
      initiateToggle(document.getElementById('theme-toggle'));
      initializeMenuToggle(document.getElementById('minMaxMenu'));
      var initializeSearch = function (search) {
          var button;
          var text;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.lastElementChild;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.lastElementChild;

          if (search) {
              search.addEventListener('keypress', function (e) {
                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
